sentences.english: "city god"), a deity in Chinese Daoist mythology who is responsible for the affairs of the city.
sentences.chinese: 城隍是中国道教神话中守护城池的神明。

sentences.english: The 2 cities have come into Liu Xuande’s possession without the least effort on his part.
sentences.chinese: 二处城池，全不费力，皆属刘玄德矣。

sentences.english: It’s St Peter’s, whom your fathers chased away.
sentences.chinese: 这城池是圣彼得的，你们的父辈将他从这里赶走。

sentences.english: Galaad is a city of workers of idols, supplanted with blood.
sentences.chinese: 基肋阿得是座作恶者的城池，满了血迹。

sentences.english: Your heart's tall city, when I can break.
sentences.chinese: 你心里的那座城池，我什么时候能攻破。

sentences.english: The Jap destroyed the rice crop, scorched the green valley and burrowed in behind the great wall.
sentences.chinese: 日本人放火烧毁庄稼，绿色的河谷和城池外的一切。

sentences.english: The character could survive a siege although at great cost.
sentences.chinese: 人物可以养活一座城池，尽管这是巨大的花费。
士兵们占领了这座城池。

sentences.english: At the east of city, glinting river, that is silver.
sentences.chinese: 在城池的正东，河流闪闪发光，那是银色。

sentences.english: The building and defending of circumvallation is the key to the Southern Sung Dynasty government.
sentences.chinese: 城池的建设与守卫是南宋政府存亡的关键。

definition: Dacheng county in Langfang 廊坊[Lang2 fang2], Hebei/Tacheng township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
(of troops stationed in a strategic area) to defend/(fig.) to stand guard/to protect
